Description:
DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,039,869 TO THE SAND COUNTY FOUNDATION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO REDUCE NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION AND ENHANCE WATER QUALITY USING SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES AND MONITORING IN THE GULF OF MEXICO WATERSHED.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE DEMONSTRATIONS ON FARMS AND ACROSS A TWO-STATE REGION, MISSISSIPPI AND ALABAMA, FOCUSED ON INFILTRATION, WATER HOLDING CAPACITY, LEACHING POTENTIAL, AGGREGATE STABILITY, AND OTHER DYNAMIC SOIL PROPERTIES, CRITICAL TO CLIMATE RESILIENCY AND NUTRIENT TRANSPORT. FARMERS WILL BE EQUIPPED WITH REAL TIME MANAGEMENT ASSESSMENT TECHNOLOGY TO PROVIDE FEEDBACK ON HOW THEIR FIELDS ARE FUNCTIONING WITHIN A SOIL HEALTH MANAGEMENT SYSTEM TO BETTER INFORM IN SEASON MANAGEMENT. FARMER COOPERATORS WILL SHARE THEIR CONSERVATION EXPERIENCES.  SUBRECIPIENT:SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO IMPLEMENT 18 FIELD DAYS FOCUSED ON SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES.  
 OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE 1 VIRTUAL FIELD DAY, 18 IN PERSON FIELD DAYS, 2 MAGAZINE ARTICLES, AND OUTREACH TO OVER 500 FARMERS, INCLUDING 24 HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED FARM COOPERATORS. FARMER CONSERVATION PRACTICES WILL BE IMPROVED AND SEDIMENT AND NUTRIENT LOADS TO LOCAL WATER BODIES WILL BE REDUCED. FARMERS AND RESIDENTS, IN THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI RIVER (STATE OF MISSISSIPPI) AND MOBILE RIVER BASINS (STATE OF ALABAMA), WILL BENEFIT FROM REDUCED NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION AND IMPROVED WATER QUALITY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,499,999 TO THE UNIVERSITY OF HOUSTON. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE AND PROTECT THE WATER QUALITY OF THE GULF OF MEXICO BY REMOVING EXCESS NUTRIENTS IN STORMWATER RUNOFF. FLOATING AQUATIC PLANTS WILL BE USED TO SEQUESTER NUTRIENTS SUCH AS NITROGEN, PHOSPHORUS, AND HEAVY METALS.ACTIVITIES:DEMONSTRATIONS FROM RESEARCHERS WILL DEVELOP A SYSTEM TO MOVE THE RAFT CONTAINING GRASSES AND RICE PLANTS IN POTS TO THE CENTER OF THE WATERSHED AND RETURN TO THE SHORELINE WHEN IT IS READY FOR HARVEST. AFTER HARVESTING THE SEEDS, THE BIOMASS WILL BE PYROLYZED TO BIOCHAR AND USED AS A SOIL AMENDMENT TO INCREASE ABSORPTION OF EXCESS NUTRIENTS IN AGRICULTURAL FIELDS. IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS APPROACH WILL REDUCE ALGAL BLOOM IN WATERWAYS AND BENEFIT THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.    SUBRECIPIENT:SUBRECIPIENTS WILL LEAD THE EXPERIMENTAL DESIGN, QUANTIFY ENVIRONMENTAL COMPONENTS, ASSIST WITH GROWING AQUATIC PLANTS, DEVELOP TESTBEDS TO GROW SORGHUM, AND APPLY THE BIOCHAR FROM THE PLANTS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ALSO INCLUDE DATA ANALYSIS, MONITORING, AND BIOCHAR CONVERSION.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE DEVELOPING AND DEMONSTRATING A NEW FLOATING AQUATIC PLANT SYSTEM THAT CAN RELIABLY REMOVE ABOUT 50-60% OF NUTRIENTS FROM THE WATERSHED. FINDINGS WILL REVEAL THE MOST SUITABLE CONDITIONS TO PRODUCE BIOCHAR AND THE PERCENTAGE OF FERTILIZER REDUCTION. ONE-DAY WORKSHOPS WILL BE ORGANIZED TO EDUCATE THE STAKEHOLDERS ABOUT THE AQUATIC PLANT SYSTEM BY EXPLAINING TO THEM THE CONCEPT AND INTENDED BENEFITS. RESIDENTS AND COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE TEXAS GULF COAST WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,284,481 TO THE B.F. SMITH FOUNDATION TO IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF THE GULF OF MEXICO. ON-FARM DEMONSTRATIONS WILL BE CONDUCTED TO EVALUATE INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGIES AND STRATEGIES THAT CAN BE INTEGRATED INTO FARMING SYSTEMS TO DIRECTLY ADDRESS NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT LOADING INTO WATERBODIES. ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CHARACTERIZING AGRICULTURAL AND ECOLOGICAL SYSTEMS, IDENTIFYING CONSTRAINTS TO SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE, DESIGNING PLANS FOR ADAPTING COVER CROP MINIMUM TILLAGE SYSTEMS, AND EVALUATING ADVANCED NUTRIENT MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES AND ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOMES. ALSO, THE KNOWLEDGE GAINED FROM THIS PROJECT WILL BE DISSEMINATED THROUGH FARMER-TO-FARMER EXCHANGE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:GREATER THAN 5% POLLUTANT REDUCTION WILL BE DOCUMENTED WITHIN A SELECTED WATERBODY BY REDUCING THE USE OF SYNTHETIC FERTILIZERS AND REPLACING OR SUPPLEMENTING THESE FERTILIZERS WITH CARBON-BASED FERTILIZERS AND IMPLEMENTING COVER CROP MINIMUM TILLAGE SYSTEMS. THESE SYSTEMS WILL BE DEMONSTRATED ON A MINIMUM OF 12,000 ACRES, WITH A FOCUS ON NON-IRRIGATED FIELDS AND PIVOT IRRIGATED FIELDS. ADVANCED NUTRIENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS USING CARBON-BASED FERTILIZER AND MINIMUM TILLAGE SYSTEMS WILL BE DEMONSTRATED ON 1,500 ACRES. MEASURABLE CHANGES WILL BE DOCUMENTED USING PREMIER DIGITAL NITROGEN MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE AS WELL AS WATER QUALITY MONITORING. ALSO, FARMER-TO-FARMER OUTREACH AND EXCHANGES WILL IMPACT AT LEAST 500 INDIVIDUALS ANNUALLY. AGRICULTURAL LANDOWNERS AND RESIDENTS OF THE MISSISSIPPI DELTA WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY THROUGH THE REDUCTION OF NUTRIENT LOADS TO THE GULF OF MEXICO.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,465,119 TO MISSISSIPPI STATE UNIVERSITY TO ENHANCE AND PROTECT THE WATER QUALITY OF THE GULF OF MEXICO THROUGH THE REDUCTION OF NON-POINT SOURCE NUTRIENT POLLUTION FROM AGRICULTURE. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO LEVERAGE RESOURCES TO IDENTIFY AND OVERCOME BARRIERS THAT RESTRAIN THE ADOPTION OF PRECISION AND REGENERATIVE AGRICULTURAL TECHNOLOGIES, APPROACHES, AND STRATEGIES THAT CAN REDUCE NUTRIENT POLLUTION. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IDENTIFYING FACTORS THAT INFLUENCE ADOPTION OF NUTRIENT#8208;REDUCING PRACTICES, DEMONSTRATING ON#8208;FARM THE TECHNOLOGIES, APPROACHES AND STRATEGIES THAT REDUCE EXCESS NUTRIENT LOADS, AND STRENGTHENING EXISTING FARMER#8208;TO#8208;FARMER NETWORKS TO DISSEMINATE INFORMATION AND PROMOTE ADOPTION OF INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGIES AND CONSERVATION STRATEGIES. DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN ONLINE RESPONSE TOOL TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ON BARRIERS FACED BY GROWERS, 15 FARM DEMONSTRATIONS, AND 6 WATER QUALITY MONITORING SITES. OUTREACH MATERIALS WILL BE DELIVERED TO AN EXISTING 500-MEMBER, MINORITY LED FARMER TO FARMER NETWORK. NUTRIENT LOADING TO SURFACE WATERBODIES WILL BE REDUCED UP TO 60% WHILE MAINTAINING OR IMPROVING CROP PRODUCTIVITY AND PROFITABILITY. RESIDENTS AND COMMUNITIES IN THE FIVE GULF OF MEXICO STATES WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY.ACTIVITIES:-SUBRECIPIENT:SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO IMPLEMENT DEMONSTRATIONS FOR A MINORITY LED FARMER TO FARMER NETWORK.  OUTCOMES:-

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,499,837 TO THE LOUISIANA STATE UNIVERSITY AGRICULTURAL CENTER TO ENHANCE AND PROTECT THE WATER QUALITY OF THE GULF OF MEXICO BY REDUCING NONPOINT SOURCE NUTRIENT LOADS. THIS PROJECT WILL DEMONSTRATE HOW MODIFICATIONS TO AN EXISTING NATURAL WETLAND, DISTURBED BY URBAN EXPANSION, CAN BE IMPLEMENTED EFFICIENTLY TO REDUCE EXCESS NITROGEN AND PHOSPHORUS LOADING IN URBAN STORMWATER RUNOFF.ACTIVITIES:BAMBOO AND GIANT CANE WILL BE PLANTED ON THE EARTHEN WEIR TO ACT AS A LIVING FILTER TO EXCLUDE /CATCH LITTER FROM ENTERING THE WETLANDS. TWO ABANDONED BORROW PITS WILL BE CONNECTED TO THE PRIMARY OUTFALL INTO THE WETLANDS AND ACT AS THE PRIMARY SEDIMENT TRAP FOR STORMWATER NUTRIENT REMEDIATION. A WOOD CHIP BIOREACTOR WILL BE USED AS A SECONDARY SYSTEM TO REMOVE NUTRIENTS AND FINE SEDIMENTS DRAINING FROM THE BORROW PITS PRIOR TO DISCHARGE OF TREATED STORMWATER INTO A STORMWATER CANAL.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO DESIGN, PROCURE, IMPLEMENT, AND MAINTAIN BIOFILTERS, IN ADDITION TO WATER SAMPLING ANALYSIS AND REPORTING OF ALL RESULTS.   OUTCOMES:THE DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT ARE CHANGES IN NITROGEN AND PHOSPHORUS RATES IN ADDITION TO THE DEMONSTRATION OF LITTER AND SOLID DETENTION VIA INNOVATIVE BIOREACTOR TECHNOLOGY AND A TWO BORROW PIT SYSTEM. ULTIMATELY, THE REDUCED NUTRIENTS (NITROGEN AND PHOSPHORUS), COARSE PARTICULATES (SEDIMENTATION), AND LITTER WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED HABITAT AND WATER QUALITY OF LOUISIANA GULF OF MEXICO WATERSHEDS, AND CONSEQUENTLY THE GULF OF MEXICO AS A WHOLE. THE RESIDENTS OF BATON ROUGE, LOUISIANA AND THE COMMUNITIES ALONG COASTAL LOUISIANA IN THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,444,519 TO GROUNDWORK NEW ORLEANS INC. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE HABITAT AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF THE GULF OF MEXICO THROUGH THE DEMONSTRATION OF INNOVATIVE BIOREMEDIATION TECHNIQUES TO REDUCE NUTRIENTS IN URBAN RUNOFF.ACTIVITIES:FOUR SAMPLE SITES WILL BE IDENTIFIED (TWO POINT SOURCE AND TWO NON-POINT SOURCE) IN MOBILE, NEW ORLEANS, AND DALLAS, WHERE BASELINE TESTING WILL BE CONDUCTED AND THE USE OF BIOREMEDIATION TECHNOLOGY WILL BE DEMONSTRATED. THROUGH OUTREACH AND TRAINING WORKSHOPS, CITIZEN SCIENTISTS WILL BE TRAINED TO PERFORM SEDIMENT AND WATER TESTING. ADDITIONALLY, AN EDUCATIONAL SERIES SUMMARIZING THE RESULTS OF THE THREE-YEAR STUDY WILL BE PRESENTED TO EACH COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IMPLEMENTING BIOREMEDIATION APPLICATIONS, DEVELOPING A QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN, DISSEMINATING PROJECT RESULTS, AND CONDUCTING COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED WATER QUALITY, ENHANCED COMMUNITY RESILIENCE, REPLICABLE OUTREACH AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS, AND REPLICABLE/SCALABLE BIO-STIMULANT TREATMENT PLANS. NUTRIENT LEVELS (SPECIFICALLY NITROGEN AND PHOSPHORUS) WILL BE REDUCED AT EACH PROJECT SITE, FOR A TOTAL COMBINED WATERSHED AREA OF 27,500 SQUARE MILES. AQUATIC HABITATS WILL BE PROTECTED AND RESTORED, WHICH CONSEQUENTLY WILL IMPROVE AND PROTECT THE GULF OF MEXICO. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THREE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, STUDENTS OF ALL AGES, AND THE GULF SOUTH REGION AS A WHOLE, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM ENHANCED HABITAT AND COMMUNITY RESILIENCE AND IMPROVED WATER QUALITY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,499,759 TO THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH FLORIDA TO RESTORE THE HEALTH AND PRODUCTIVITY OF THE GULF OF MEXICO BY REDUCING RUNOFF AND NUTRIENT DISCHARGES FROM AN URBAN STORM WATER POND INTO TAMPA BAY. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE STAKEHOLDER OUTREACH, INSTALLATION OF BIO-INFILTRATION SYSTEMS (GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE), AND EXPERIMENTAL AND MODELING STUDIES ASSESSING BIO-INFILTRATION REDUCTIONS ON RUNOFF AND NUTRIENT DISCHARGES. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE AN ONLINE STORM WATER RESOURCE BOOK AND ATLAS; ENHANCED STORM WATER MANAGEMENT MODEL AND UPDATED APPLICATIONS; FOUR DEMONSTRATION BIO-INFILTRATION SYSTEMS; AND REDESIGN OF AARAN'S POND WITH IMPROVED POND NUTRIENT REMOVAL, AESTHETICS, AND SAFETY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE 22 ACRES OF HABITAT PROTECTED, ENHANCED, AND RESTORED; MODELING TOOLS ADOPTED TO ESTIMATE NUTRIENT LOAD REDUCTION; AND IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF STORM WATER AND WATER QUALITY ISSUES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE UNIVERSITY AREA COMMUNITY RESIDENTS AND THE COMMUNITIES NEAR TAMPA, FL, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY AND ENHANCED COMMUNITY RESILIENCE.ACTIVITIES:.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO IMPLEMENT NUTRIENT ANALYSIS OF STORM WATER POND SAMPLES AND TO PROVIDE LOGISTICAL SUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE WITH RECRUITING AND SUPERVISING INTERNS AND VOLUNTEERS.

 OUTCOMES:.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $687,094 TO AUBURN UNIVERSITY TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS WITH IMPROVING THE WATER QUALITY OF THE GULF OF MEXICO USING OYSTER REEF FILTRATION AS A METHOD TO ADDRESS WASTEWATER DISCHARGES AND NUTRIENT POLLUTION.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: INCLUDE THE EMPLACEMENT OF TWO CLASS/AGE SIZES OF OYSTERS IN THE SUBTIDAL ZONE NEAR CODEN, ALABAMA AND THE ANALYSIS OF OYSTER TISSUE AND WATER AND SEDIMENT SAMPLES TO DETERMINE CONCENTRATIONS OF NITROGEN AND PHOSPHORUS. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF USING RESTORED OYSTER REEF FILTRATION CAPACITY AS A METHOD TO ADDRESS WASTEWATER DISCHARGES AND NUTRIENT POLLUTION IN THE NEAR SHORE ENVIRONMENT. NITROGEN AND PHOSPHORUS CONCENTRATIONS IN WATER COLUMNS, OYSTERS, AND SEDIMENTS WILL BE MONITORED AND QUANTIFIED. BIOLOGICAL SUCCESS WILL BE DEFINED BY THE PRESENCE OF OYSTERS DEMONSTRATING SPAWNING BEHAVIOR DURING QUARTERLY SAMPLINGS THAT CORRELATE WITH EXPECTED SPAWNING SEASONS (SUMMER AND FALL). THE CITIZENS INHABITING AND UTILIZING NEARSHORE/ESTUARINE SYSTEMS WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY.ACTIVITIES:.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF USING RESTORED OYSTER REEF FILTRATION CAPACITY AS A METHOD TO ADDRESS WASTEWATER DISCHARGES AND NUTRIENT POLLUTION IN THE NEAR SHORE ENVIRONMENT. NITROGEN AND PHOSPHORUS CONCENTRATIONS IN WATER COLUMNS, OYSTERS, AND SEDIMENTS WILL BE MONITORED AND QUANTIFIED. BIOLOGICAL SUCCESS WILL BE DEFINED BY THE PRESENCE OF OYSTERS DEMONSTRATING SPAWNING BEHAVIOR DURING QUARTERLY SAMPLINGS THAT CORRELATE WITH EXPECTED SPAWNING SEASONS (SUMMER AND FALL). THE CITIZENS INHABITING AND UTILIZING NEARSHORE/ESTUARINE SYSTEMS WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,304,942 TO THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH ALABAMA TO ENHANCE AND PROTECT THE WATER QUALITY OF THE GULF OF MEXICO BY REDUCING NONPOINT SOURCE NUTRIENT LOADS AND REMOVING NUTRIENTS FROM URBAN STORMWATER RUNOFF. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DEVELOPING NUTRIENT ADSORBING GEOTEXTILES FOR GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE APPLICATION WHILE ALSO STUDYING THEIR PERFORMANCE UNDER REAL-WORLD STORMWATER TREATMENT AND INVESTIGATING THEIR LIFE EXPECTANCY. RESULTS OF THIS DEMONSTRATION PROJECT WILL BE DISSEMINATED IN PEER-REVIEWED JOURNALS, CONFERENCES, AND EDUCATIONAL PRESENTATIONS AT TITLE 1 SCHOOLS TO ENGAGE UNDERSERVED YOUTH. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES UPON COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE GENERATION OF A NEW TECHNOLOGY AND KNOWLEDGE THAT CAN BE IMPLEMENTED INTO EXISTING AND FUTURE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE TO REDUCE NUTRIENT LOADS FROM URBAN STORMWATER RUNOFFS. THE RESULTS WILL PROVIDE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN GEOTEXTILE ELEMENTS AND THE REMOVAL OF CONTAMINANTS FROM NON-POINT SOURCE RUNOFF. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO YIELD AN OVERALL TECHNOLOGY ASSESSMENT, WITH RECOMMENDATIONS ON DEPLOYMENT AND OPERATION, THAT WILL HELP INFORM TOWARDS THE RAPID IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS TECHNOLOGY, TO MITIGATE POLLUTION AND IMPROVE HABITAT BY REMOVAL OF NUTRIENTS FROM ENTERING THE GULF OF MEXICO. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS OF THE CITIES OF MOBILE AND AUBURN AND THE COMMUNITIES NEAR MOBILE BAY AND COASTAL ALABAMA, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY.  ACTIVITIES:.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO DEVELOP AND CHARACTERIZE THE HYBRID GEOTEXTILE MATERIALS AND HYDRAULIC PROPERTIES, CONDUCT GEOTEXTILE FIELD TESTING AND STORMWATER QUALITY ANALYSIS, AND TO LEAD THE OUTREACH INITIATIVE (EDUCATION PRESENTATIONS), ORGANIZE BI-ANNUAL WORKSHOPS, AND COORDINATE FIELD TRIPS FOR UNDERSERVED YOUTH PARTICIPATION. OUTCOMES:.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,000,000 TO THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF CONSERVATION DISTRICTS INC. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY BY IMPLEMENTING COMPETITIVE SUB-AWARDS TO ENGAGE WITH ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS ACROSS THE NON-MISSISSIPPI RIVER GULF REGION, INCREASING THE ABILITY OF HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED FARM COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS NUTRIENT POLLUTION AND FREQUENT FLOODING.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE A COMPETITIVE SUB-AWARD PROGRAM TO ASSIST UNDERSERVED FARMERS WITH IMPROVING WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT. THERE WILL BE COLLABORATIVE MEETINGS AND OUTREACH PERFORMED WITH SUB-AWARD RECIPIENTS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO IMPLEMENT COMPETITIVELY SELECTED PROJECTS WITH FOCUS ON THE KEY AREAS OF WATER QUALITY, HABITAT, AND UNDERSERVED FARMER AND FARM COMMUNITY SUPPORT AND OUTREACH.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AWARDING 90% OF FUNDS THROUGH SUB-AWARDS, IMPROVING WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT TO BUILD RESILIENCE. THE SUB-AWARDS WILL OCCUR TWICE A YEAR FOR TWO YEARS OF THE PROJECTS, WITH 3-4 YEAR PROJECT PERIODS. 15-35 SUB-AWARDS WILL BE COMPLETED. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN THE NON-MISSISSIPPI RIVER REGION FOR THE GULF OF MEXICO, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT THROUGH DEMONSTRATIONS OF INNOVATIVE PRACTICES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,000,000 TO THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF STATE DEPARTMENTS OF AGRICULTURE RESEARCH FOUNDATION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO UNDERSERVED FARMERS TO PROTECT AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE TO DEVELOP A GRANTS MANAGEMENT SYSTEM FOR TRACKING SUB-AWARDS AND TO WORK WITH SUB-AWARDEES TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO UNDERSERVED FARMERS TO PROTECT AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT. PROGRAMS WILL BE IMPLEMENTED TO PREVENT OR REDUCE NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION, INCLUDING NUTRIENTS AND PLASTIC POLLUTION.SUBRECIPIENT:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE IMPLEMENTED THROUGH SUB-AWARDS INCLUDE DEVELOPING AND DEPLOYING A GRANTS MANAGEMENT SYSTEM FOR MONITORING OTHER SUB-AWARDEES, WORKING DIRECTLY WITH UNDERSERVED FARMERS THROUGH 17 REGIONAL SUB-AWARDS, AND PROVIDING PLATFORM SUPPORT FOR THE GRANTS MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE THAT FARMERS OR FARMING COMMUNITIES WILL ADOPT SUSTAINABILITY/RESILIENCY PRACTICES AND PRACTICES THAT LEAD TO REDUCED NUTRIENT LOSSES AND IMPROVED WATER QUALITY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE NUTRIENT REDUCTION, HABITAT IMPROVEMENT, AND/OR SUSTAINABLE FORESTS PROTECTED. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE UNDERSERVED FARMERS AND RESIDENTS IN THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE REGIONS (HUCS 05 AND 06) WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY.

DESCRIPTION:GULF OF MEXICO PROGRAM

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,000,000 TO WINROCK INTERNATIONAL. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT 8 TO 20 ORGANIZATIONS COLLABORATING WITH UNDERSERVED FARMERS ON WATER QUALITY, HABITAT, OR FORESTRY IMPROVEMENTS, THUS REDUCING PHOSPHORUS AND NITROGEN LOSS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE DEVELOPING AN ADVISORY GROUP TO INFORM THE APPLICATION PROCESS, CO-DEVELOPING THE TYPES OF CAPACITY-BUILDING OFFERED, BUILDING TRUST AND AWARENESS AMONG POTENTIAL APPLICANTS, AND SERVING AS MENTORS TO SUB-AWARDEES. A COMPETITIVE SUB-AWARD PROGRAM WILL BE ESTABLISHED TO FUND AND MONITOR SUB-AWARDS AND TO PROVIDE SUPPORT AND TRAININGS TO SUB-AWARDEES. THE PROJECT RESULTS WILL BE REPORTED TO STAKEHOLDERS AND PEERS.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO ASSIST WITH MENTORSHIP OF SUB-AWARDEES, PROVIDE CAPACITY BUILDING (INCLUDING MONITORING EVALUATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL MODELING) TO SUB-AWARDEES, AND IMPLEMENT 8-20 COMPETITIVELY SELECTED PROJECTS.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A COMPETITIVE SUB-AWARD PROGRAM TO DIRECTLY SUPPORT AT LEAST 8 ORGANIZATIONS, 100 FARMERS, AND 7,500 ACRES WITH A MIX OF AGRICULTURE, HABITAT, AND FORESTRY MANAGEMENT PRACTICES. THIS SUPPORT IS ANTICIPATED TO RESULT IN 1,400 POUNDS REDUCTION IN PHOSPHORUS LOSS OR 19,000 POUNDS REDUCTION IN NITROGEN LOSS IN THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER REGION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS, TOURISTS, AND FISHERMAN WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY IN THE UPPER AND LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER BASINS AND THE GULF OF MEXICO.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,000,000 TO THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY BY IMPLEMENTING COMPETITIVE SUB-AWARDS TO ENGAGE WITH ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS ACROSS THE MISSOURI RIVER REGION, INCREASING THE ABILITY OF HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED FARM COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS NUTRIENT POLLUTION AND FREQUENT FLOODING.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE A COMPETITIVE SUB-AWARD PROGRAM TO ASSIST UNDERSERVED FARMERS THAT WILL REDUCE NITRATE AND PHOSPHOROUS LOADS. THERE WILL BE COLLABORATIVE MEETINGS AND OUTREACH PERFORMED WITH SUB-AWARD RECIPIENTS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS. SUBRECIPIENT:SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO IMPLEMENT COMPETITIVELY SELECTED PROJECTS WITH FOCUS ON THE KEY AREAS OF NUTRIENT REDUCTION, FLOOD RESILIENCE BUILDING, AND UNDERSERVED FARMER AND FARM COMMUNITY SUPPORT AND OUTREACH.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AWARDING 97% OF FUNDS THROUGH SUB-AWARDS, REDUCING NITRATE LOADS BY 41% AND PHOSPHORUS LOADS BY 29%, AND REDUCING RUNOFF TO BUILD RESILIENCE. THE SUB-AWARDS WILL OCCUR TWICE A YEAR FOR TWO YEARS OF THE PROJECTS, WITH 3-4 YEAR PROJECT PERIODS. AT LEAST 8 SUB-AWARDS WILL BE COMPLETED. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN THE MISSOURI RIVER REGION OF WESTERN IOWA, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY THROUGH A REDUCTION IN NUTRIENT POLLUTION.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $296,859 TO THE TEXAS A&AMPANDM UNIVERSITY AGRILIFE EXTENSION SERVICE. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO REDUCE AND PREVENT WATER POLLUTION AS WELL AS IMPROVE COMMUNITY RESILIENCE THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE (GI) PROJECTS.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $299,881 TO MISSISSIPPI STATE UNIVERSITY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE AND ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION WITHIN THE GULF OF MEXICO WATERSHED. 
ACTIVITIES:
ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IS THE  TRAINING AND CERTIFYING STUDENTS IN AREAS THAT WILL PROPEL THEM INTO EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN COASTAL SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, AND MATHEMATICS (STEM) CAREERS.  STEM TRAINING AND HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS SKILLS THAT ARE INTEGRAL TO CAREERS IN COASTAL RESTORATION AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE.
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE WATERCRAFT OPERATION AND CERTIFICATION, UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEMS OPERATION AND CERTIFICATION, NAVIGATION AND MAPPING, BASIC ELECTRICAL SYSTEMS, SENSOR CONSTRUCTION AND CODING, NURSERY METHODS AND PLANTING TECHNIQUES, AND DATA ANALYSIS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO HAVE OVER 40 STUDENTS OBTAIN EMPLOYMENT IN AN ENVIRONMENTAL FIELD OR BEGIN AN ENVIRONMENTALLY FOCUSED COLLEGE PROGRAM, AT LEAST 100 STUDENTS WITH INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL SKILLS AND CONFIDENCE, AND THE PROGRAM WILL BE SUSTAINED FOR YEARS TO COME. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS AND WORKFORCE IN THE COASTAL MISSISSIPPI WATERSHED, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM ENHANCED GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE AND ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION.
SUBRECIPIENT:
SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO CONDUCT TRAINING TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE OF LOCAL PLANT ECOLOGY AND DEMONSTRATE A VARIETY OF TECHNIQUES FOR GROWING PLANTS.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $298,506 TO ECORISE YOUTH INNOVATIONS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO INCREASE GULF-RELATED ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY; BUILD ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP; AND DEVELOP SKILLS TO SECURE STEM, SUSTAINABILITY, AND GREEN BUILDING CAREERS.

ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE BUILDING A NEW ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AND SUSTAINABILITY (EPS) CAREER PATHWAY FOCUSED ON GREEN BUILDING AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE (GI),   PROVIDING TEACHERS WITH THE TOOLS THEY NEED TO ADVANCE GULF ENVIRONMENTAL-RELATED WORK READINESS IN HIGH SCHOOL YOUTH, AND ACTIVATING STUDENTS IN GRADES 9-12 TO SERVE AS SUSTAINABILITY LEADERS BY INCREASING THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY.
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE AN INCREASE IN GULF-RELATED ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY FOR ABOUT 360 STUDENTS; 18 TEACHERS AND 90 STUDENTS GAINING A PROFESSIONAL GREEN BUILDING CREDENTIAL; AND 30 UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN A SUMMER INTERNSHIP PROGRAM RELATED TO GI AND GREEN BUILDING PRACTICES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN INCREASE IN CONFIDENCE, COMPETENCY, AND ENTHUSIASM FOR GREEN BUILDING. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE COMMUNITIES IN NEW ORLEANS, LA AS WELL AS NEARBY GULF COAST COMMUNITIES WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM GULF-RELATED ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, AND GREEN BUILDING PRACTICES. 
SUBRECIPIENT:
SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO IMPLEMENT SIX GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE-RELATED STUDENT PROJECTS.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $496,646 TO MQVN COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CONSORTIUM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO DEMONSTRATE EFFECTIVE SOLUTIONS TO MITIGATE STORM WATER RUNOFF, REDUCE NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION, AND ENHANCE COMMUNITY RESILIENCE USING GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE (GI) PRACTICES IN THE GULF OF MEXICO WATERSHED.

ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE THREE GI DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS WITH RIPARIAN BUFFERS, BIO-SWALES, AND FLOATING WETLANDS, PRE AND POST DEMONSTRATION WATER QUALITY AND QUANTITY ANALYSES, AND EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO THE COMMUNITY. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE 100,000 GALLONS PER YEAR OF STORM WATER RUNOFF PREVENTED, TWO ACRES OF HABITAT ENHANCED, IMPROVED WATER QUALITY, AND ENHANCED KNOWLEDGE OF 200 COMMUNITY MEMBERS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE VILLAGE DE L'EST RESIDENTS AND THE COMMUNITIES NEAR NEW ORLEANS EAST, LOUISIANA WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM ENHANCED COMMUNITY RESILIENCE.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $342,856 TO HEALTHY COMMUNITY SERVICES. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO REDUCE NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION AND ENHANCE COMMUNITY RESILIENCE USING GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE (GI) PRACTICES IN THE GULF OF MEXICO WATERSHED.
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO THE COMMUNITIES NEAR N. CLAIBORNE AVENUE IN NEW ORLEANS TO DEVELOP GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS, IMPLEMENTING FROM 7 TO 10 DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS, AND MODELING THEIR IMPACT ON WATER QUALITY AND QUANTITY BENEFITS.

ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE 7-10 GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS IMPLEMENTED NEAR N. CLAIBORNE AVENUE AND WATER QUALITY AND QUANTITY BENEFITS DETERMINED. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COMMUNITY OUTREACH EFFORTS IN DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING GI PROJECTS AND ALSO TRAINING AND CERTIFYING WATER WISE NEIGHBORHOOD CHAMPIONS.

DESCRIPTION:

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PRACTICES INTO THE AGING STORM WATER MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS IN THE CITY OF MOSS POINT, MISSISSIPPI.

OUTCOMES:
THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN ESTIMATED 50-85% REDUCTION IN NON-POINT SOURCE POLLUTION AND 50-80% INCREASED INFILTRATION AT THE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE INSTALLATION SITES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE COMMUNITIES LOCATED AROUND MOSS POINT, MISSISSIPPI AND THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY. THIS PROJECT INTENDS TO ISSUE A SUB AWARD TO THE MISSISSIPPI STATE UNIVERSITY EXTENSION SERVICE TO PROVIDE INFRASTRUCTURE PLANNING AND COORDINATION WITH THE CITY, AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $499,440 TO THE COUNTY OF SANTA ROSA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO DEMONSTRATE THE EFFECTIVE DESIGN, IMPLEMENTATION, AND MAINTENANCE OF GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE (GI) INCLUDING VEGETATED BIO-SWALES, TREE BOXES, AND PERMEABLE SURFACE THROUGHOUT THE 8.6-ACRE SANTA ROSA COUNTY ADMINISTRATIVE COMPLEX.  
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE DESIGNING, ENGINEERING, AND PERMITTING OF GI THROUGHOUT THE COMPLEX. WATER SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS WILL BE COMPLETED FOR 5 PARAMETERS FOR 16 RAIN EVENTS AT FIVE SITES FOR ORTHOPHOSPHATE, TOTAL NITRATE-NITRITE, TOTAL PHOSPHORUS, TOTAL NITROGEN, AND COLIFORM BACTERIA LEAVING THE SITE. THE COMMUNITY WILL BE INVITED TO TOUR THE PROJECT THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA AND MEDIA RELEASES FROM THE SRC PIO OFFICE, FURTHER MAXIMIZING THE NUMBER OF CITIZENS WITH ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING OF GI PRACTICES. THE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES WILL ENGAGE DEVELOPERS, HOMEBUILDERS, COMMUNITY RESIDENTS, AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS WHO CAN ADVANCE IMPLEMENTATION OF GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE.
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE ENHANCED KNOWLEDGE FOR SIX COMMUNITIES REGARDING RISK MANAGEMENT RELATED TO CLIMATE AND STORM WATER VULNERABILITIES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE 16 ON-SITE TOURS REACHING 500 PARTICIPANTS THAT INCLUDE RESIDENTS, BUSINESS MEMBERS, CONTRACTORS, AND DEVELOPERS. THE PROJECT AREA WILL SEE A REDUCTION OF N OF 143 LB/YR, OR A 59% AND P 20 LB/YR, OR A 59%. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF SANTA ROSA COUNTY, FL WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATERSHED QUALITY.



SUBRECIPIENT:
SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IMPLEMENTING GI PRACTICES AND COLLECTING AND ANALYZING WATER QUALITY CHARACTERISTICS PRE AND POST IMPLEMENTATION.

NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $499,478 TO MISSISSIPPI STATE UNIVERSITY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO REDUCE LITTER AND THE USE OF SINGLE-USE ITEMS BY EDUCATING COMMUNITIES AND PROVIDING TOOLS/ALTERNATIVES TO SINGLE-USE ITEMS.
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE SERVING THE COMMUNITY BY PROMOTING SUSTAINABLE SWAPS AND LITTER PREVENTION EDUCATION TO COASTAL MISSISSIPPIANS THROUGH HANDS-ON, BI-MONTHLY WORKSHOPS TARGETING HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS, THEIR INVITED FAMILIES, AND MEMBERS OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC. THEMED WORKSHOPS WILL SURVEY HABIT CHANGES, INSTILL PREVENTION MEASURES, PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE MATERIALS, REDUCE LITTER AT ITS SOURCE, AND PROVIDE PARTICIPATING SCHOOLS WITH TOOLS TO REDUCE WASTE.
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE OUTREACH PRODUCTS AND PUBLICATIONS AND MSU EXTENSION PUBLISHED CURRICULUM. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE 20,000 LBS OF TRASH PREVENTED FROM ENTERING THE ENVIRONMENT AND IMPROVED WATER QUALITY AND UNDERSTANDING OF WATER QUALITY CONDITIONS IN AT LEAST 5 COMMUNITIES. ALSO, THERE WILL BE AN IMPROVED CONSUMER KNOWLEDGE OF TRASH FREE AND SUSTAINABLE PRACTICES BY AN AVERAGE OF AT LEAST 10% ACROSS AT LEAST 600 INDIVIDUALS, 7 ORGANIZATIONS THAT UTILIZE MORE SUSTAINABLE PRODUCTS AVAILABLE TO CONSUMERS, AND 10,000 LBS OF TRASH REMOVED FROM THE ENVIRONMENT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE STUDENTS AT 5 SELECTED SCHOOLS IN THE SIX COASTAL COUNTIES OF MISSISSIPPI, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY THROUGH THE REDUCTION OF LITTER.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $500,000 TO THE CITY OF TAMPA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE WATER QUALITY AND PREVENT TRASH FROM ENTERING WATERWAYS FLOWING INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $485,559 TO THE CLEAN MEMPHIS ORGANIZATION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PREVENT TRASH FROM ENTERING THE PRIORITY LANDSCAPES OF THE GULF OF MEXICO.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE INSTALLING TOUCHLESS REFILLABLE WATER STATIONS IN SCHOOLS, DOWNTOWN COMMUNITY PARKS IN MEMPHIS, AND RIVERFRONT PARKS. DEVELOPING THE PUBLIC'S AND SCHOOLS' AWARENESS OF ENCOURAGING THE USE OF REFILLABLE WATER CONTAINERS TO PREVENT PLASTIC DISPOSABLE WATER BOTTLES FROM ENTERING THE GULF OF MEXICO WATERSHED. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE INSTALLATION OF 50 REFILLABLE WATER BOTTLE STATIONS TO REPLACE THE EXCESSIVE USE OF PLASTIC DISPOSABLE WATER BOTTLES, THE DEVELOPMENT OF A TRASH PREVENTION CAMPAIGN, AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF CASE STUDIES FOR THE REPLICATION OF WATER REFILL STATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO REDUCE SINGLE-USE PLASTIC WATER BOTTLES AND THE POLLUTION WHICH DERIVES FROM THE BOTTLES TO CREATE AND TO IMPROVE CONSUMER KNOWLEDGE/UNDERSTANDING BY 20%. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS IN THE CITY OF MEMPHIS AND ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM LESS TRASH ENTERING THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND ULTIMATELY THE GULF OF MEXICO.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $406,377 TO THE COASTAL BEND BAYS AND ESTUARIES PROGRAM, INC. OF TEXAS TO CREATE THE 'UP2U PLUS' PROGRAM, WHICH WILL PREVENT TRASH FROM REACHING TEXAS COASTAL WATERWAYS BY BUILDING UPON AN EXISTING SUCCESSFUL LITTER PREVENTION CAMPAIGN TO ENCOURAGE PROPER TRASH DISPOSAL AND REDUCE ILLEGAL DUMPING.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $87,640 TO THE CITY OF FORT MYERS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROTECT THE CALOOSAHATCHEE RIVER WATERSHED AND PREVENT TRASH FROM REACHING THE GULF OF MEXICO THROUGH THE COMBINATION OF EDUCATIONAL AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH ACTIVITIES. 
ACTIVITIES:
THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COORDINATING WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE TRASH-REDUCTION PROGRAM AND INNOVATIVELY CREATING A COORDINATED COMMUNITY OUTREACH PROGRAM FOR TRASH AND LITTER PREVENTION.
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE CONDUCTING OUTREACH TO 9,000 STUDENTS AND 1,000 COMMUNITY MEMBERS, CREATING ONE CURRICULUM FOR SCHOOLS, AND CREATING ONE BUSINESS OUTREACH PROGRAM AND ONE TRASH FREE WATERS WEBSITE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE PREVENTION OF OVER 1.5 MILLION PIECES OF TRASH ENTERING THE ENVIRONMENT, BEHAVIORAL CHANGES IN OVER 900 CONSUMERS, CHANGE IN PRACTICES FOR 20 BUSINESSES, AND THE REMOVAL OF 276 CUBIC FEET OF TRASH. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZENS OF FORT MYERS, FL, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATERSHED QUALITY.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $499,757 TO THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER CITIES AND TOWNS INITIATIVE OF MISSOURI. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND PRODUCTIVITY OF THE GULF OF MEXICO THROUGH THE REDUCTION AND PREVENTION OF TRASH ENTERING THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER.
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE COMMUNITY-ESTABLISHED SOURCE REDUCTION ACTIONS, INSTALLATION OF WATER FILLING STATIONS, EDUCATION, REPLACEMENT OF UNSUSTAINABLE PRODUCTS/PRACTICES (E.G., RESTAURANTS), AND THE COLLECTION OF TRASH IN STORM DRAIN INLET CAPTURE DEVICES.
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE REDUCTION OF 5,000 SINGLE USE BOTTLES PER MONTH THROUGH USE OF WATER REFILL STATIONS; 300,000 CONSUMERS, 500 BUSINESSES, AND 20 INSTITUTIONS ENGAGED THROUGH 50 RESOURCES AND 20 PROGRAMS; AND DATA ON LITTER COLLECTED AT 50 TRANSECTS AND AT STORM DRAIN CAPTURE DEVICES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE 75% REDUCTION IN TRASH PREVENTED FROM ENTERING THE ENVIRONMENT, 80% INCREASE IN COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING, 50% CHANGE IN PRACTICES/APPROACHES RESULTING IN THE PREVENTION OF TRASH FROM REACHING WATERWAYS TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY IN THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE TARGETED COMMUNITIES IN ST. LOUIS, MO, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY THROUGH THE REDUCTION AND PREVENTION OF LITTER.
SUBRECIPIENT:
SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE FOSTERING A COLLABORATIVE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROCESS, WORKING DIRECTLY WITH RESTAURANTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR NEGATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT, EMPLOYING WASTE DIVERSION METHODS, AND CONDUCTING EDUCATION AND OUTREACH REGARDING EXTENDED PRODUCER RESPONSIBILITY AND SUSTAINABLE PACKAGING.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $499,852 TO THE LOUISIANA STATE UNIVERSITY AGRICULTURAL CENTER. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO USE A MULTI-PRONG APPROACH TO PREVENT AND REMEDIATE TRASH IN BATON ROUGE WATERSHEDS THAT FLOWS INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO.
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE OUTREACH TO COMMUNITIES TO REDUCE AND PREVENT SURFACE TRASH, ENGAGEMENT WITH BUSINESS AND UNIVERSITIES TO INSTALL WATER FILLING STATIONS AND REPLACE UNSUSTAINABLE PRODUCTS AND THE UTILIZATION OF INNOVATIVE TRASH-TRAP SYSTEM OR PLASTIC POLLUTION PREVENTION AND COLLECTION TECHNOLOGY.
OUTCOMES:
THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE THE ENGAGEMENT OF OVER 5,000 INDIVIDUALS AND 25 ORGANIZATION, 10 TRASH REDUCTION RESOURCES DEVELOPED OR PROVIDED, DEVELOPMENT OF A BASELINE LITTER INDEX AND INSTALLATION OF WATER FILLING STATIONS AND TRASH-TRAP SYSTEMS. EXPECT OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE REMOVAL OF 100 TONS OF TRASH ALONG WITH IMPROVEMENTS TO WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WILL BE THE COMMUNITIES IN BATON ROUGE, SPECIFICALLY SCOTLANDVILLE AND OLD SOUTH BATON ROUGE IN LOUISIANA WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE REDUCTION AND PREVENTION OF TRASH AND PLASTIC POLLUTION. 
SUBRECIPIENT:
THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS TO PERFORM COMMUNITY AND UNIVERSITY ENGAGEMENT AND LOCATING, IMPLEMENTING, AND MAINTAINING THE TRASH CATCHMENT DEVICES AT THE TWO DEMONSTRATION SITES.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $499,638 TO ECKERD COLLEGE IN FLORIDA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE LAND PROTECTION AND CONSERVATION IN PRIORITY LANDSCAPES OF THE GULF OF MEXICO. 
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE CREATING AN INNOVATIVE PHONE APPLICATION TO REDUCE CONSUMPTION OF UNNECESSARY SINGLE-USE PLASTIC BY INDIVIDUALS AND PROVIDE PLASTIC USE AND REFUSAL DATA TO GUIDE SUSTAINABILITY POLICIES.
OUTCOMES:
THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE A MOBILE PHONE APPLICATION, CLEANUP EVENTS, AND DATA SHARING. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE PREVENTING SINGLE-USE PLASTIC FROM ENTERING THE ENVIRONMENT, REMOVING URBAN DEBRIS, ENHANCING HABITAT IN THE TAMPA BAY ESTUARY, AND MAKING ST. PETERSBURG, FL A MORE RESILIENT COMMUNITY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WILL BE THE COMMUNITIES NEAR OR LOCATED IN ST. PETERSBURG AND TAMPA BAY, FL, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM ENHANCED LAND PROTECTION AND CONSERVATION. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO PERFORM CLEANUP EVENTS AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES.
SUBRECIPIENT:

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $465,013 TO THE UNIVERSITY OF HOUSTON - CLEAR LAKE. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO DETERMINE THE SOURCE OF FECAL CONTAMINATION IN TWO WATERSHEDS THAT CONNECT TO GALVESTON BAY TO ENHANCE LAND PROTECTION AND WATER QUALITY IN THE GULF OF MEXICO.
 


ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE TRACKING THE SOURCE OF FECAL CONTAMINATION OF CHRONICALLY IMPAIRED WATERWAYS IN THE WESTERN GALVESTON BAY WATERSHED AND DEMONSTRATING THE CONCEPT OF A REAL-TIME, POINT-OF-SAMPLING METHODOLOGY FOR DETECTING THE AMOUNT AND SOURCE OF FECAL CONTAMINATION.   
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A RAPID, POINT-OF-SAMPLING MST AND RISK-ASSESSMENT PROTOCOL THAT WILL ALLOW MANAGERS TO TRACK SOURCES IN THE FIELD AND PROVIDE DATA DURING EXTREME WEATHER EVENTS. IN ADDITION, THE EDUCATION OF STUDENTS THROUGH THIS PROJECT WILL EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ABOUT THE SOURCES AND RISKS OF FECAL CONTAMINATION IN WEST GALVESTON BAY. THOSE EDUCATED WILL INCLUDE HUNDREDS OF STUDENTS FROM GROUPS TRADITIONALLY UNDERREPRESENTED IN SCIENCE IN PROJECTS THAT INVOLVE BIOINFORMATICS. IN THE END GALVESTON BAY COMMUNITIES WILL BECOME MORE RESILIENT TO THE HARMFUL CONTAMINATION THAT CAN OCCUR DURING SEVERE WEATHER EVENTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE COMMUNITIES LOCATED IN AND AROUND WESTERN GALVESTON BAY, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED COMMUNITY RESILIENCE AND WATER QUALITY.  
SUBRECIPIENT:
SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED TO CONDUCT METAGENOMIC ANALYSIS AND TO DISSEMINATE RESULTS TO THE PUBLIC AND STAKEHOLDERS THROUGH OUTREACH PROGRAMS.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $494,349 TO TEXAS AANDM UNIVERSITY CORPUS CHRISTI. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE FECAL POLLUTION SOURCE ASSESSMENT IN THE BAFFIN BAY WATERSHED (TEXAS, NORTHWESTERN GULF OF MEXICO) TO ENHANCE LAND PROTECTION AND WATER QUALITY.


 


ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE COLLECTING WATER QUALITY SAMPLES AND SCREENING THEM TO IDENTIFY FECAL POLLUTION AND DEVELOPING EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS. THIS PROJECT WILL USE MICROBIAL SOURCE TRACKING TO IDENTIFY FECAL POLLUTANT SOURCES AND FACILITATE ENHANCED MANAGEMENT PRIORITIZATION. 
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE WATERSHED MONITORING OVER 3 YEARS USING 4 DIFFERENT FECAL COLIFORM TARGETS THAT WILL RESULT IN A QUANTITATIVE ASSESSMENT OF HUMAN HEALTH RISKS. ADDITIONALLY, BILINGUAL EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES WILL BE DEVELOPED TO HELP INFORM LOCAL COMMUNITIES OF THE HEALTH RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH FECAL CONTAMINATION IN WATERWAYS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE HEALTH RISK MITIGATION AND IMPROVED HUMAN HEALTH OUTCOMES THROUGH TARGETED INFORMATION DELIVERY TO ECONOMIC DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES WITH ELEVATED ENVIRONMENTAL POLLUTANT EXPOSURES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE COMMUNITIES SURROUNDING THE BAFFIN BAY WATERSHED WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM ENHANCED LAND PROTECTION AND WATER QUALITY.
SUBRECIPIENT:
SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE QMRA OVERSIGHT AND DISSEMINATION OF MICROBIAL SOURCE TRACKING RESULTS, WATER SAMPLING, AND EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $497,659 TO LOUISIANA STATE UNIVERSITY TO IDENTIFY SOURCES OF MICROBIAL POLLUTION TO DISCERN WHERE INTERVENTION IS NEEDED IN A TRIBUTARY OF THE GULF OF MEXICO AND  TEST A NOVEL SOLUTION TO THE PROBLEM OF INSUFFICIENTLY TREATED WASTEWATER UTILIZING DEVICES THAT COMBINE ULTRAVIOLET LIGHT-EMITTING DIODES WITH CHLORINE..
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE ASSESSMENT OF FECAL POLLUTION SOURCES IN THE YELLOW WATER AND NATALBANY RIVERS, DEVELOPMENT OF NOVEL TECHNOLOGY-ULTRAVIOLET LIGHT-EMITTING DIODES , ASSESSMENT OF THE EFFICACY OF THE ULTRAVIOLET LIGHT-EMITTING DIODES TECHNOLOGY, COLLABORATION WITH LOCAL AND STATE ENTITIES AND PROVIDE OUTREACH TO THE PUBLIC TO CONVEY RESULTS OF THE PROJECT.
OUTCOMES:
 THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE VALIDATED AND OPTIMIZED MICROBIAL SOURCE TRACKING DDPCR ASSAYS FOR USE IN LOUISIANA, 18 MONTHS OF DATA IDENTIFYING AND QUANTIFYING FECAL POLLUTION SOURCES FROM 2 STREAM SEGMENTS AND DATA COLLECTION TO DETERMINE THE EFFICACY OF THE ULTRAVIOLET LIGHT-EMITTING DIODES TO RESULTS IN A MINIMUM OF TWO PUBLICATIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS IN THE FORM OF FECAL CONTAMINATION REDUCTIONS IN TWO WATER SEGMENTS ALONG WITH DEVELOPMENT OF AN EFFECTIVE, COST EFFICIENT TECHNOLOGY FOR LOW-MAINTENANCE DISINFECTION OF ON-SITE WASTEWATER SYSTEM EFFLUENT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WILL BE THE COMMUNITIES IN TANGIPAHOA PARISH NEAR THE YELLOW WATER AND NATALBANY RIVERS WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE IMPROVED WATER QUALITY. THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS TO PERFORM STAKEHOLDER COORDINATION AND ENGAGEMENT
SUBRECIPIENT:

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $446,442 TO THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH FLORIDA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO UTILIZE NOVEL MICROBIAL SOURCE TRACKING (MST) APPROACHES AND HIGH-THROUGHPUT QPCR TO ASSESS RELATIONSHIPS AMONG FECAL INDICATOR BACTERIA, MST MARKERS AND PATHOGENS, AND TO QUANTIFY HUMAN HEALTH RISK.
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE CONDUCTING BACTERIAL SOURCE TRACKING, CALCULATING RISK TO RECREATIONAL WATER USERS, AND DEVELOPING A GUIDANCE DOCUMENT FOR REGULATORS AND MANAGERS. 
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE DEVELOPING AN MST GUIDE FOR GOVERNMENT PARTNERS TO IMPROVE DECISION-MAKING ON WATER QUALITY ISSUES THROUGHOUT THE GULF OF MEXICO AND HOLDING A WEBINAR TO DISSEMINATE RESULTS OF THE PROJECT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE IMPROVED STRATEGIES FOR DETERMINING SOURCES OF FECAL CONTAMINATION AND THEIR ABILITY TO PREDICT HUMAN HEALTH RISK IN FIVE DISTINCT FLORIDA WATER BODIES THAT IMPACT THE GULF OF MEXICO. THESE STRATEGIES WILL BE HIGHLY TRANSFERABLE TO WATER BODIES ACROSS THE GULF OF MEXICO. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZENS OF TAMPA BAY, FLORIDA AND THE GULF REGION, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED WATER QUALITY.
SUBRECIPIENT:
SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED FOR ANALYSIS OF 100 SAMPLES BY MFQPCR FOR 40 FIB, MST, PATHOGEN AND ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE GENES.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $498,144 TO THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH ALABAMA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE WATER QUALITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION WITHIN THE GULF OF MEXICO WATERSHED. MICROBIAL SOURCE TRACKING WILL BE USED TO IDENTIFY CONTAMINANTS AND DEVELOP IDEAS ON REMOVAL.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $480,011 TO THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY IN THE WATERSHEDS OF THE GULF OF MEXICO. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $994,287 TO THE SAVANNA INSTITUTE TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS WITH IMPROVING WATER QUALITY IN THE GULF OF MEXICO THROUGH REDUCTION OF NUTRIENT EXPORT TO THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. THIS PROJECT WILL ENGAGE FARMERS TO FACILITATE WIDER ADOPTION OF AGROFORESTRY TECHNIQUES ON FARMS AS A WAY OF REDUCING NITROGEN AND PHOSPHOROUS TO IMPROVE LOCAL WATER QUALITY AND REDUCE HYPOXIA AND HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOM IMPACTS.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $299,860 TO MISSISSIPPI STATE UNIVERSITY (MSU). THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE COMMUNITY RESILIENCE USING EDUCATION AND OUTREACH AND HABITAT RESTORATION PRACTICES IN THE GULF OF MEXICO WATERSHED.
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE TO EXPAND EDUCATIONAL TRAINING PROGRAMS ON GROWING NATIVE PLANTS FOR HABITAT RESTORATION THROUGH THE ESTABLISHED PLAN-IT MARSH PROGRAM AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE PLAN-IT DUNE PROGRAM. THROUGH THESE PROGRAMS, SKILLS WILL BE DEVELOPED IN THE INSTALLATION OF GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE THROUGH PROPAGATION AND PLANTING OF NATIVE PLANTS TO RESTORE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST MARSH AND DUNE HABITATS. 
OUTCOMES:
ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE AT LEAST 4 EDUCATION AND TRAINING MODULES DEVELOPED AS PART OF THE PLAN-IT MARSH AND PLAN-IT DUNES PROGRAMS, 10 HIGH SCHOOLS WITH THE SUPPLIES AND EXPERTISE TO GROW THEIR OWN NATIVE MARSH/DUNE PLANTS, AND 5 EDUCATIONAL EXCHANGE PROGRAMS BETWEEN GULF COAST HIGH SCHOOLS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE APPROXIMATELY 200-250 HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WITH STEM CAREER SKILLS EDUCATION AND TRAINING, INCREASED LIKELIHOOD OF CONTINUATION OF PLAN-IT MARSH AND PLAN-IT DUNES PROGRAM, AT LEAST 10 ACRES OF NATIVE MARSH AND DUNE PLANT COMMUNITIES RESTORED, AND INCREASED LIKELIHOOD OF OUTREACH EDUCATORS DEVELOPING PARTNERSHIPS WITH HIGH SCHOOLS TO FURTHER ADVANCE STEM CAREER SKILLS AND RESTORATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS AND COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST, WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM ENHANCED COMMUNITY RESILIENCE AND HABITAT RESTORATION.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $959,754 TO THE NORTHWEST FLORIDA WATER MANAGEMENT DISTRICT TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS WITH IMPROVING WATER QUALITY IN THE GULF OF MEXICO THROUGH NUTRIENT (ALGAE) REMOVAL FROM RETENTION PONDS TO REDUCE DEPENDENCY ON COMMERCIAL FERTILIZERS. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $997,383 TO THE SAND COUNTY FOUNDATION, WISCONSIN, TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS WITH IMPROVING WATER QUALITY IN THE GULF OF MEXICO THROUGH FARMING PRACTICES THAT REDUCE SEDIMENT AND NUTRIENT RUNOFF. THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PRACTICES LIKE AS REDUCED-TILL, COVER-CROPS, ROTATIONAL GRAZING, EXTENDED CROP-ROTATIONS, AND PERENNIAL VEGETATION, THERE WILL BE REDUCED SEDIMENT AND NUTRIENT RUNOFF, IMPROVED INFILTRATION, AND A MORE RESILIENT AGRICULTURAL SYSTEM TO DELIVER A CLEANER, SAFER, AND HEALTHIER ENVIRONMENT.

ULTIMATELY THIS PROJECT WILL RESTORE UP TO 40 ACRES OF SEAGRASS HABITAT.

THE PROJECT WILL PROTECT AND RESTORE CRITICAL HABITAT, PROVIDE CLEAN AND SAFE WATER, AND ENHANCE ENVIRONMENTAL FUNCTION OF THE WATERSHED AND AQUATIC RESOURCES FOR LISTED SPECIES AND PUBLIC USE.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,150,000 FOR THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND LAND STEWARDSHIP TO DEMONSTRATE WETLAND INSTALLATION PRACTICES IN IOWA TO MAXIMIZE PERFORMANCE FOR NUTRIENT REMOVAL, WETLAND HABITAT FUNCTION, AND TO ESTABLISH A FUNCTIONAL WETLAND DELIVERY MODEL IN THE MIDDLE CEDAR RIVER BASIN. WORKING WITH BOTH AGRICULTURAL AND URBAN GROUPS, THIS PROJECT WILL FOSTER EXPANDED DELIVERY OF WETLANDS ON THE LANDSCAPE AND DISSEMINATE THE INFORMATION NECESSARY TO WATERSHED STAKEHOLDERS TO BUILD UPON THIS SUCCESS.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,064,926 FOR THE UNIVERSITY OF IOWA TO DEMONSTRATE TO FARMERS HOW TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY USING NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT REDUCTION PRACTICES IN THE JOHNSON COUNTY HISTORIC POOR FARM, LOCATED ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF IOWA CITY AND THE LOWER IOWA RIVER WATERSHED WITHIN THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER BASIN.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $935,788 FOR PRACTICAL FARMERS OF IOWA TO EQUIP IOWA FARMERS WITH TOOLS TO ACCELERATE IMPLEMENTATION OF COVER CROPS THROUGH SHIFTING THE TONE OF MAINSTREAM AGRICULTURE, DOUBLING THE NUMBER OF COVER CROP CHAMPIONS, LOWERING BARRIERS TO IMPLEMENTATION; AND MEASURING A 5% IMPROVEMENT IN WATER QUALITY. FARMERS WILL BE TRAINED TO BECOME 'COVER CROP CHAMPIONS' SO THEY CAN EDUCATE AND MENTOR OTHER FARMERS.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,149,813 FOR THE B.F. SMITH FOUNDATION TO WORK ON FARMING SYSTEMS THAT DEMONSTRATE AN INNOVATIVE WATERSHED APPROACH ADVANCING SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,088,025 FOR MISSISSIPPI STATE UNIVERSITY TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY. THROUGH LESSONS LEARNED, FARMERS WILL ORGANIZE AND USE RESOURCES TO MAKE MANAGEMENT IMPROVEMENTS IN THEIR WATERSHEDS LONG AFTER THIS PROJECT IS COMPLETE.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $695,614 FOR LOUISIANA UNIVERSITIES MARINE CONSORTIUM TO MONITOR THE WATER QUALITY BEFORE AND AFTER REPAIRING INDIVIDUAL HOME SEWAGE SYSTEMS. THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $328,101 FOR DOG RIVER CLEARWATER REVIVAL TO CONDUCT A COMPREHENSIVE ASSESSMENT OF TRASH SOURCES, TRANSPORT ROUTES, FATE AND ENFORCEMENT EFFECTIVENESS IN THE UPPER DOG RIVER WATERSHED. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $755,761 FOR UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH ALABAMA TO BUILD RURAL WASTEWATER MANAGEMENT CAPACITY AND ADDRESS WATER QUALITY IMPAIRMENTS IN RURAL SOUTH AND CENTRAL ALABAMA WATERSHED.
